trans-unit.source: How to create a Virtual Machine Running Windows Server
trans-unit.target: How to create a Virtual Machine Running Windows Server

trans-unit.source: Describes how to create a Windows virtual machine, add a data disk, and log on remotely
trans-unit.target: Describes how to create a Windows virtual machine, add a data disk, and log on remotely

trans-unit.source: Create a Virtual Machine Running Windows Server
trans-unit.target: Create a Virtual Machine Running Windows Server

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how easy it is to create an Azure virtual machine running Windows Server, using the Image Gallery in the Windows Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how easy it is to create an Azure virtual machine running Windows Server, using the Image Gallery in the Windows Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: The Image Gallery offers a variety of images, including Windows operating systems, Linux-based operating systems, and application images.
trans-unit.target: The Image Gallery offers a variety of images, including Windows operating systems, Linux-based operating systems, and application images.

trans-unit.source: You don't need any experience with Azure VMs to finish this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You don't need any experience with Azure VMs to finish this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: However, you do need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: However, you do need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: You can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: You can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>Create an Azure account</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>Create an Azure account</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>How to create the virtual machine</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>How to create the virtual machine</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>How to log on to the virtual machine after you create it</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>How to log on to the virtual machine after you create it</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>How to attach a data disk to the new virtual machine</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>How to attach a data disk to the new virtual machine</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: If you'd like to know more, see <link><linkText>Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you'd like to know more, see <link><linkText>Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>How to create the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>How to create the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: This section shows you how to use the From Gallery option in the Management Portal to create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This section shows you how to use the From Gallery option in the Management Portal to create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: This option provides more configuration choices than the Quick Create option.
trans-unit.target: This option provides more configuration choices than the Quick Create option.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to join a virtual machine to a virtual network, you'll need to use the From Gallery option.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to join a virtual machine to a virtual network, you'll need to use the From Gallery option.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>How to log on to the virtual machine after you create it
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>How to log on to the virtual machine after you create it

trans-unit.source: This section shows you how to log on to the virtual machine so you can manage its settings and the applications that you'll run on it.
trans-unit.target: This section shows you how to log on to the virtual machine so you can manage its settings and the applications that you'll run on it.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the Azure <link><linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the Azure <link><linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click Virtual Machines, and then select the MyTestVM virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Click Virtual Machines, and then select the MyTestVM virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select MyTestVM</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select MyTestVM</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the command bar, click Connect.
trans-unit.target: On the command bar, click Connect.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connect to MyTestVM</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connect to MyTestVM</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Open to use the remote desktop protocol file that was automatically created for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Click Open to use the remote desktop protocol file that was automatically created for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Open the rdp file</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Open the rdp file</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Continue with connecting</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Continue with connecting</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the password box, type the user name and password that you specified when you created the virtual machine, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: In the password box, type the user name and password that you specified when you created the virtual machine, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Click Yes to verify the identity of the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Click Yes to verify the identity of the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Verify the identity of the machine</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Verify the identity of the machine</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can now work with the virtual machine just like you would a server in your office.
trans-unit.target: You can now work with the virtual machine just like you would a server in your office.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>How to attach a data disk to the new virtual machine
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>How to attach a data disk to the new virtual machine

trans-unit.source: This section shows you how to attach an empty data disk to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This section shows you how to attach an empty data disk to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: See the [Attach a Data Disk Tutorial] (../articles/virtual-machines/storage-windows-attach-disk.md) for more information on attaching empty disks as well as how to attach existing disks.
trans-unit.target: See the [Attach a Data Disk Tutorial] (../articles/virtual-machines/storage-windows-attach-disk.md) for more information on attaching empty disks as well as how to attach existing disks.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the Azure <link><linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the Azure <link><linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click Virtual Machines, and then select the MyTestVM virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Click Virtual Machines, and then select the MyTestVM virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select MyTestVM</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select MyTestVM</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You may be taken to the Quick Start page first.
trans-unit.target: You may be taken to the Quick Start page first.

trans-unit.source: If so, select Dashboard from the top.
trans-unit.target: If so, select Dashboard from the top.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select Dashboard</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select Dashboard</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the command bar, click Attach, and then click Attach Empty Disk when it pops up.
trans-unit.target: On the command bar, click Attach, and then click Attach Empty Disk when it pops up.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select Attach from the command bar</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select Attach from the command bar</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Virtual Machine Name, Storage Location, File Name, and Host Cache Preference are already defined for you.
trans-unit.target: The Virtual Machine Name, Storage Location, File Name, and Host Cache Preference are already defined for you.

trans-unit.source: All you have to do is enter the size that you want for the disk.
trans-unit.target: All you have to do is enter the size that you want for the disk.

trans-unit.source: Type 5 in the Size field.
trans-unit.target: Type 5 in the Size field.

trans-unit.source: Then click the check mark to attach the empty disk to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Then click the check mark to attach the empty disk to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Specify the size of the empty disk</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Specify the size of the empty disk</linkText>

trans-unit.source: All disks are created from a VHD file in Windows Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: All disks are created from a VHD file in Windows Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: Under File Name, you can provide the name for the VHD file that is added to storage, but Azure generates the name of the disk automatically.
trans-unit.target: Under File Name, you can provide the name for the VHD file that is added to storage, but Azure generates the name of the disk automatically.

trans-unit.source: Return to the dashboard to verify that the empty data disk was successfully attached to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Return to the dashboard to verify that the empty data disk was successfully attached to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: It will be listed as a second disk in the Disks list along with the OS Disk.
trans-unit.target: It will be listed as a second disk in the Disks list along with the OS Disk.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attach empty disk</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attach empty disk</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After you attach the data disk to the virtual machine, the disk is offline and not initialized.
trans-unit.target: After you attach the data disk to the virtual machine, the disk is offline and not initialized.

trans-unit.source: Before you can use it to store data, you'll need to log on to the virtual machine and initialize the disk.
trans-unit.target: Before you can use it to store data, you'll need to log on to the virtual machine and initialize the disk.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the virtual machine by using the steps in the previous section, [How to log on to the virtual machine after you create it] (#logon).
trans-unit.target: Connect to the virtual machine by using the steps in the previous section, [How to log on to the virtual machine after you create it] (#logon).

trans-unit.source: After you log on to the virtual machine, open Server Manager.
trans-unit.target: After you log on to the virtual machine, open Server Manager.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, select File and Storage Services.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, select File and Storage Services.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Expand File and Storage Services in Server Manager</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Expand File and Storage Services in Server Manager</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Disks from the expanded menu.
trans-unit.target: Select Disks from the expanded menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Expand File and Storage Services in Server Manager</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Expand File and Storage Services in Server Manager</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Disks section, there are three disks in the list: disk 0, disk 1, and disk 2.
trans-unit.target: In the Disks section, there are three disks in the list: disk 0, disk 1, and disk 2.

trans-unit.source: Disk 0 is the OS disk, disk 1 is a temporary resource disk (which should not be used for data storage), and disk 2 is the data disk you have attached to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Disk 0 is the OS disk, disk 1 is a temporary resource disk (which should not be used for data storage), and disk 2 is the data disk you have attached to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Note that the data disk has a capacity of 5 GB as specified earlier.
trans-unit.target: Note that the data disk has a capacity of 5 GB as specified earlier.

trans-unit.source: Right-click disk 2 and then select Initialize.
trans-unit.target: Right-click disk 2 and then select Initialize.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Start initialization</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Start initialization</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Yes to start the initialization process.
trans-unit.target: Click Yes to start the initialization process.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Continue initialization</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Continue initialization</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Right-click disk 2 again and select New Volume.
trans-unit.target: Right-click disk 2 again and select New Volume.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create the volume</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create the volume</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Complete the wizard using the default values provided.
trans-unit.target: Complete the wizard using the default values provided.

trans-unit.source: Once the wizard is finished, a new volume will be listed in the Volumes section.
trans-unit.target: Once the wizard is finished, a new volume will be listed in the Volumes section.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create the volume</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create the volume</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The disk is now online and ready to use with a new drive letter.
trans-unit.target: The disk is now online and ready to use with a new drive letter.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.target: To learn more about configuring Windows virtual machines on Azure, see the following articles:

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Attach Data Disks to a Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Manage the Availability of Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>
